solution_line_template: There are {minutes_per_hour} minutes in an hour so {jog_hours} hour {jog_minutes} minutes is equivalent to [{jog_hours} + ({jog_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour})] hours = <<{jog_time_per_day}={jog_time_per_day}>>{jog_time_per_day} hours
There are {days_per_week} days in a week so he spends {jog_time_per_day}*{days_per_week} = <<{days_per_week}*{jog_time_per_day}={jog_time_per_week}>>{jog_time_per_week} hours jogging every week
After {num_weeks} weeks he will have spent {num_weeks}*{jog_time_per_week} = <<{num_weeks}*{jog_time_per_week}={total_jog_time}>>{total_jog_time} hours jogging.
